distroi.model.geom_comp.geom_comp module

Defines the classes and methods for representing geometric components and calculating their complex visibilities.

These geometric components can be used in conjunction to RT models in the calculation of interferometric observables. A geometric component also includes a spectral profile to describe its flux dependence accross wavelength. By default, the spectrum is assumed to be flat in F_lam.

NOTE: A flat spectrum in F_lam implies a dependency of F_nu ~ nu^-2 ~ lambda^2. Hence, the correlated flux will not be flat. Take this in mind when calculating or comparing to observations in correlated flux.

class distroi.model.geom_comp.geom_comp.Gaussian(fwhm: float, coords: Optional[tuple[float, float]] = None, sp_dep: Optional[distroi.model.dep.spec_dep.SpecDep] = None)

Bases: distroi.model.geom_comp.geom_comp.GeomComp

Class representing a Gaussian geomteric component:

Parameters

  • fwhm (float) – Full-width-half-maximum of the Gaussian in the image plane (in mas units).

  • coords (tuple(float)) – 2D tuples with (x, y) coordinates of the point’s coordinates (in mas). Note that positive x is defined as leftward and positive y as upward (i.e. the East and North repesctively in the OI convention). If not given, will default to (0, 0).

  • sp_dep (SpecDep) – Optional spectral dependence of the component. If None, the spectral dependency will be assumed flat in F_lam flux accross wavelength (note that flatness in F_lam means a spectral dependency ~ wavelength^2 ~ frequency^-2 for F_nu, and thus for the correlated flux).

Variables

  • fwhm (float) – See parameter description.

  • coords (tuple(float)) – See parameter description.

  • sp_dep (SpecDep) – See parameter description.

_abc_impl = <_abc._abc_data object>
calc_vis(uf: numpy.ndarray | float, vf: numpy.ndarray | float, wavelength: Optional[Union[numpy.ndarray, float]] = None, ref_wavelength: Optional[float] = None, ref_corr_flux: Optional[float] = None) → numpy.ndarray | float

Calculate the visibility at given spatial frequencies. Wavelengths corresponding to these spatial frequencies a and a reference flux value (at reference wavelength) can also be passed along, in which case the returned visibilities will be in correlated flux (Jy) instead of normalized.

Parameters

  • uf (np.ndarray) – 1D array with spatial x-axis frequencies in 1/radian. Must be the same size as uf.

  • vf (np.ndarray) – 1D array with spatial y-axis frequencies in 1/radian. Must be the same size as vf.

  • wavelength (np.ndarray) – 1D array with wavelength values in micron.

  • ref_wavelength (float) – Reference wavelength in micron.

  • ref_corr_flux (float) – Reference correlated flux in Jy corresponding to ref_wavelength. If provided together with ref_corr_flux, then the returned visibilities are in correlated flux.

Return vis

1D array with the calculated visibilities (normalized or in corrleated flux, depending on the optional arguments)

Return type

np.ndarray

class distroi.model.geom_comp.geom_comp.GeomComp

Bases: abc.ABC

Abstract class representing a geometric model component.

Variables

  • params (dict[str, Param]) – Dictionary containing the names of parameters within the GeomComp scope and the corresponding parameter objects.

  • sp_dep (spec_dep.SpecDep) – Optional spectral dependence of the component. If not specified at init, the spectral dependency will be assumed flat in F_lam flux accross wavelength (note that flatness in F_lam means a spectral dependency ~ wavelength^2 ~ frequency^-2 for F_nu, and thus for the correlated flux).

_abc_impl = <_abc._abc_data object>
abstract calc_vis(uf: numpy.ndarray | float, vf: numpy.ndarray | float, wavelength: Optional[Union[numpy.ndarray, float]] = None, ref_wavelength: Optional[float] = None, ref_corr_flux: Optional[float] = None) → numpy.ndarray | float

Calculate the visibility of the geometric component at given spatial frequencies. Wavelengths corresponding to these spatial frequencies and a reference total flux (at reference wavelength) can also be passed along, in which case the returned visibilities will be in correlated flux (Jy) instead of normalized.

Parameters

  • uf (np.ndarray | float) – 1D array with spatial x-axis frequencies in 1/radian. Must be the same size as uf.

  • vf (np.ndarray | float) – 1D array with spatial y-axis frequencies in 1/radian. Must be the same size as vf.

  • wavelength (np.ndarray | float) – 1D array with wavelength values in micron.

  • ref_wavelength (float | None) – Reference wavelength in micron.

  • ref_corr_flux (float | None) – Reference correlated flux in Jy corresponding to ref_wavelength. If provided together with ref_corr_flux, then the returned visibilities are in correlated flux.

Return vis

1D array with the calculated visibilities (normalized or in corrleated flux, depending on the optional arguments)

Return type

np.ndarray | float

class distroi.model.geom_comp.geom_comp.UniformDisk(diameter: float, coords: Optional[tuple[float, float]] = None, sp_dep: Optional[distroi.model.dep.spec_dep.SpecDep] = None)

Bases: distroi.model.geom_comp.geom_comp.GeomComp

Class representing a uniform disk geometric component.

Parameters

  • diameter (float) – The radius of the disk in milli-arcsecond.

  • coords (tuple(float)) – 2D tuples with (x, y) coordinates of the disk center’s coordinates (in mas). Note that positive x is defined as leftward and positive y as upward (i.e. the East and North repesctively in the OI convention). If not given, will default to (0, 0).

  • sp_dep (SpecDep) – Optional spectral dependence of the component. If None, the spectral dependency will be assumed flat in F_lam flux accross wavelength (note that flatness in F_lam means a spectral dependency ~ wavelength^2 ~ frequency^-2 for F_nu, and thus for the correlated flux).

Variables

  • radius (float) – See parameter description.

  • coords (tuple(float)) – See parameter description.

  • sp_dep (SpecDep) – See parameter description.
